alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 9:18PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Grafton County through 945 PM EDT... At 917 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Franconia, or 9 miles southwest of Bethlehem, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bethlehem, Lincoln, Franconia, Easton and Sugar Hill. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 103 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
